content: 4 row 1 rs p2 p1 k1b p2tog k2 p2tog k1b p1 p2tog repeat 5 times p1 row 2 ws k1 k2 p1b k1 p2 k1 p1b k1 repeat 5 times k2 row 3 rs p2 p1 k1b p2tog p2tog k1b p2tog repeat 5 times p1 row 4 ws k1 k2tog repeat 15 times k2 you have 18 sts remaining your work should measure approx 24 cm from the cast-on edge end on a ws row seaming & finishing break the yarn with enough of a tail to close up and seam the hat indicatively about 3 times the length of the vertical edge thread a tapestry needle with this yarn lay your work and needle flat with the rs facing up and the cast on edge closest to you thread through the live stitches from the left edge towards the right edge as if making a drawstring around the crown once you have threaded through all sts drop them off the knitting needle and draw the stitches together © anouskaknits 2025 6 honey & salt hat september 2025 to fasten them tightly to draw them together you tighten them on the stretch of yarn as if it s a drawstring next line up the vertical edges of the hat ensuring the top edges of the cuff are in line use safety pins to pin the lined-up edges in place using the same yarn you used to thread the top of the hat together join the two edges with the mattress stitch for tutorial use link or scan code note check the work as you go to ensure there is no puckering in the fabric or holes that form when edge stitches are picked up incorrectly lastly weave in all ends using the duplicate purl or knit stitch and wet block your garment to even out stitches thanks for knitting with me i d love to see how your hat turned out if you share it tag me so i can check it out @anouskaknits #anouskaknits #honeyandsalthat where to find me www anouskaknits com https //www ravelry com/people/anouskaknits © anouskaknits 2025 7 honey & salt hat september 2025 appendix a1 © anouskaknits 2025 8 honey & salt hat september 2025 a2 © anouskaknits 2025 9 honey & salt hat september 2025
